summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in bzip2-0.4.3 crate used by temporal-sdk-core-0.1.0 allows denial of service via integer overflow in large files. CVE-2023-22895 with CVSS score 7.5.
userImpact: Users of temporal-sdk-ruby are exposed to potential denial of service attacks through a vulnerable transitive dependency in the Rust SDK core.
rootCause: Integer overflow in mem.rs of bzip2-0.4.3 crate when processing large files, allowing denial of service attacks.
proposedFix: Upgrade bzip2 crate from 0.4.3 to 0.4.4 or later version that includes the fix for CVE-2023-22895.
resolutionDetails: Issue was automatically closed by Mend after the vulnerable library was removed from the dependency inventory, indicating the dependency was either upgraded or removed from the project.
keyQuote: The bzip2 crate before 0.4.4 for Rust allow attackers to cause a denial of service via a large file that triggers an integer overflow
